stances.statement: Congestion on our roadways is top of mind for everyone in our District, and is a persistent impediment to economic success and daily burden on our families. As your Senator, I will work with VDOT to widen our roadways and take a hard look at our traffic patterns to better optimize flow. I will fight to bring home funding in the budget for these vital road improvements.
Improving public transportation to better connect Northeast Minneapolis, Riverside, and the University of Minnesota community.
Transportation should be a public service, so let’s provide reliable, safe, and accessible bus, light rail, and biking alternatives!

Pushing MNDOT to bring back consideration of the Twin Cities Boulevard that would support public transit, biking and walking and repair the harms done by I-94’s destruction of Rondo and other neighborhoods.
Making transportation affordable and accessible for everyone, which helps people get to work, school, and healthcare appointments—improving quality of life while reducing inequities.
Working to reform the Met Council to make it into a more accountable and responsible body.
Accelerating the rollout of EV charging infrastructure and electric busses, especially those produced here in Minnesota.
Ensure future transit funding goes toward increasing the frequency and reliability of public transit.
Amal supports modernizing Minnesota’s transportation system to be sustainable, equitable, and efficient.
She will prioritize investments in public transit, bike- and pedestrian-friendly infrastructure, and rural road improvements.
I support making the 32 (Lowry Ave) and the 4 (Johnson St & Hennepin Ave) Bus Rapid Transit routes.
I support making transit fare free. A fare free pilot of the 32 showed that taking away the barrier of payment increased ridership and gave my children freedom to roam the city.
I will fight for a robust transit system because we cannot effectively transition away from car culture without it.

Northwest Florida has good “show-teeth,” the beautiful interstates and immaculate bridges. But I will bring in funding for infrastructure rejuvenation where it’s needed most – the parks, communities, and neighborhoods.
CONTINUE record investments in traffic-reducing projects.
I will fight for a robust transit system because we cannot effectively transition away from car culture without it.
I support making transit fare free. A fare free pilot of the 32 showed that taking away the barrier of payment increased ridership and gave my children freedom to roam the city.
I support making the 32 (Lowry Ave) and the 4 (Johnson St & Hennepin Ave) Bus Rapid Transit routes.
Louisiana needs to utilize dedicated funds to modernize and improve transportation, broadband, and public services.
Invest in quality infrastructure and roads.
Strengthening our communities through development and infrastructure initiatives enhances our residents' quality of life.

Unfair electric vehicle mandates must be ended. Let the market decide how people move themselves. I will fight to modernize existing import tariffs to increase competition. CAFE standards and other outsized burdens on auto manufacturers should be reduced. These regulations only get passed on to consumers in the forms of higher purchase price and maintenance costs. America should allow the individual importation of vehicles from overseas for private use, not just under the current show and display rules.
CONTINUE record investments in traffic-reducing projects.

Virginians are suffering due to bad energy policy. I am a strong proponent of a clean energy future, but it is imperative that we do not move too quickly as the VCEA did. Shutting down fossil fuel power generation before we have a viable alternative is unacceptable and dangerous. I intend to advance nuclear and hydroelectric power alternatives in the Commonwealth while strengthening natural gas, as it is currently the best available option.
As a State Senator, Kannan will continue to support efforts that promote renewable energy, create sustainable jobs, and invest in green energy infrastructure.

As a small business leader JJ is committed to growing our economy so that every family can thrive, and build a clean future for all of our kids to live without the fear and consequences of climate change.

Rising energy costs and redundant taxes like the car tax have Virginians’ overburdened and struggling. As your Delegate, I will vote to repeal the car tax and bad energy policy that are punishing our wallets.
Protecting natural resources and promoting clean energy solutions for a safer and healthier environment.

Apart from vastly expanding and bolstering green transit and housing, we must restore our city’s environment and urgently adopt a vision for a sustainable future to avoid irrevocable harm to our planet and marginalized groups.

Put Minnesota on a path towards a zero waste economy, enabling us to shutdown toxic trash burners like HERC that are poisoning our black and brown neighbors. It will also help us meet the mineral needs of a clean energy economy without relying on harmful mining practices.
Get fossil gas out of our homes and buildings by promoting thermal energy networks that will improve indoor and outdoor air quality and are far more efficient than tradition gas powered furnaces.
Work with Minnesota’s indigenous peoples to protect our precious wetlands and forests from sulfide mining with legislation like Prove It First and creating Lowland Carbon and Habitat Reserves.
Streamline permitting for rooftop solar to make it easier and more affordable to put solar panels on your house.

Expand state funding for tree canopy restoration in neighborhoods that have been damaged by emerald ash borer and the tornado in North Minneapolis in 2011, instead of forcing the cost onto residents with assessments.

Support the community led plans for re-envisioning I-94 that reduces emissions while also beginning to undo the devastating impact highway construction had on Twin Cities Black communities. I am also committed to communities having a voice in the process at every step.
Support majority BIPOC and low-income neighborhoods in receiving priority aid for environmental remediation and green initiatives.
She will advocate for clean energy investments, expanded public transit, and equitable environmental policies that prioritize communities most affected by pollution.
Protecting Minnesota’s natural resources and achieving net-zero emissions are central to her vision for a sustainable future.
Amal envisions Minnesota as a leader in combating climate change.

We must ensure climate action is implemented through an equity lens. Real-life impacts of climate change have landed hardest on marginalized communities. We need to make transition and mitigation resources accessible to the communities experiencing the greatest impacts, and Minnesota must make polluters pay for the damage that they have already caused our communities.

The Prove it First legislation is a common sense protection for the Boundary Waters and Lake Superior, and I support it. This would require any new mining proposal to undergo a rigorous and independent environmental review process which was conducted over the course of several years.

We need to ensure the Public Utilities Commission serves the needs of the public, not the wants of utilities. We must refocus the PUC on the public’s need for environmental protection, protection of health, respect for tribal sovereignty, and racial and economic equity as integral parts of our comprehensive regulatory approach to energy generation and transmission.
Address climate resilience through infrastructure investments, flood control measures, and coastal protections
Invest in clean energy infrastructures
Conserve public lands and natural habitats
Prioritize clean water initiatives and enforce regulations to prevent pollution in rivers, lakes, and coastal areas
Finally, a return to energy independence is fundamental to national security. We must never be held hostage by oil-rich countries that hate us or the climate zealots that want to control us.
Manufacturing Renaissance: End outsourcing and make the U.S. a global manufacturing superpower.
Energy Dominance: Unleash America's full energy potential, making us the world’s leading producer.
Pushing for energy independence to lower gas prices and utility bills, helping families and small businesses save money while strengthening our national security.
protect our environment

We need to ensure the Public Utilities Commission serves the needs of the public, not the wants of utilities. We must refocus the PUC on the public’s need for environmental protection, protection of health, respect for tribal sovereignty, and racial and economic equity as integral parts of our comprehensive regulatory approach to energy generation and transmission.

The Prove it First legislation is a common sense protection for the Boundary Waters and Lake Superior, and I support it. This would require any new mining proposal to undergo a rigorous and independent environmental review process which was conducted over the course of several years.

We must ensure climate action is implemented through an equity lens. Real-life impacts of climate change have landed hardest on marginalized communities. We need to make transition and mitigation resources accessible to the communities experiencing the greatest impacts, and Minnesota must make polluters pay for the damage that they have already caused our communities.

I support legislation that transitions our economy to one supported by clean energy and green infrastructure. Investing in solar, wind, and water energy will help us create a comprehensive network of energy sources that can match our state’s energy consumption needs while minimizing environmental impact. As other options for clean energy become available, I am eager to evaluate each of them on a case-by-case basis.
Louisiana's forests, wetlands, and coasts are not just landscapes-they're lifelines.
We need to prioritize investment in levee systems, flood mitigation, and coastal restoration in line with the Louisiana Constitution’s mandates for public safety and environmental protection.
I support developing retraining programs for workers in the fossil fuel industry and expand renewable energy projects to boost economic opportunities while reducing reliance on oil and gas.
I pledge to hold polluters accountable and invest in monitoring and reducing emissions in communities disproportionately affected by industrial pollution.

Energy independence is essential for our economy and national security, that’s why Stan supports an all-of-the-above energy approach, including traditional and renewable energy sources. By investing in local energy production, he will champion policies that create jobs, lower your energy costs, and reduce our dependence on foreign energy.

We must address climate change and make Connecticut a more climate resilient state. This district is both a coastal community and close to New York, so we are disproportionately affected by climate change. We need to make sure that our environment stays safe and healthy for generations to come, and in our legislature, I will fight to invest in resilient infrastructure and clean energy. I will work to enact legislation that preserves our air, water, soil, and environment.
I will not support anything that destroys where we live and the health of the people now and for generations to come.
Prioritize clean water initiatives and enforce regulations to prevent pollution in rivers, lakes, and coastal areas
Conserve public lands and natural habitats
Invest in clean energy infrastructures
Address climate resilience through infrastructure investments, flood control measures, and coastal protections

We must continue to monitor superfund sites for hazardous waste and clean up what we can. And in Florida, we have many nature preserves which must be protected from agricultural run-off due to the overuse of fertilizers. We cannot take nature for granted because the Earth can only absorb so much pollution before it spits it back out—contaminating our aquifers and ground water and potentially poisoning ourselves and our families.

Creating new jobs in green energy helps us address climate change while stimulating our economy at the same time. As your Congressman, I will work to pass the Green New Deal to help the people of Florida and America transition from the use of fossil fuels to clean, renewable sources of energy. I will also work to limit greenhouse gas emissions and control the amount of carbon that we release into the atmosphere.

All children deserve to feel safe at school. This is why we must secure all of our schools with the proper amount of School Resource officers and forbid biological men from entering women’s bathrooms and locker rooms. As you know, we have already seen the worst of what can happen when far-left social policy dictates our children’s safety and biological males are allowed in girl’s bathrooms. Transgender students deserve to feel safe as well, but protecting one individual’s emotional safety at the expense of another’s physical safety is never acceptable. I will work to find solutions that provide help and mental health resources to students in need without sacrificing any student’s safety or well-being.

As your Senator, I will be a strong voice for school choice because a zip code should never define a student’s success. I will advance merit-based education and admission standards and stop discriminatory race-based criteria. I will ensure that school instruction is geared solely towards academic excellence and not ridden with politics or divisive concepts. Any initiative that undermines student performance or academic rigor should go unfunded. We must return to basics, remove division from our classrooms, and stop promoting mediocrity.

Parents must be at the table in all parts of their children’s education. Time and time again, parents have been left in the dark in Loudoun County Public Schools, so much so that it has continuously received national attention. As your Senator, I will work to pass a Parent’s Bill of Rights, protecting your right to be involved in your children’s education and your right to be informed of all matters regarding your children.
As Senator, Kannan will continue advocating for increasing teacher pay, investing in school infrastructure, and ensuring every child has an opportunity to reach their full potential.

Despite the tremendous work of Governor Youngkin to improve our schools, we cannot see real change until we change the makeup of the Virginia House of Delegates and oust the far-left majority that has continuously shown they are wrong for our children. I will get politics out of the classroom, restore excellence, welcome parent involvement, and keep men out of women’s sports and locker rooms.
Advocating for affordable tuition, increased state funding for the University of Minnesota, and programs to reduce the burden of student debt.
Our children and students are the future, and we must guarantee them the tools to learn and to dream so that they may accomplish wonders.
Education is a human right.
I support guaranteed increases on the school funding formula that keeps pace with inflation. We must also address the cross subsidy in special education.

Energy efficiency improvements to buildings, solar for schools (many of which have flat roofs) and matching funds for battery electric school buses. Because of the plummeting cost of solar and batteries, this can save our school a lot of money over time.
We must invest in trade schools for young people who might want another path from college.
One way we can do it that I will fight for is universal, culturally-specific, free preschool. Another is equitable funding of our public schools based on the children’s needs.
Expand the Teachers of Color Act so that our school communities reflect our diverse neighborhoods.
Expand funding for childcare providers to ensure childcare workers are receiving a living wage and reverse the decline in the number of providers without passing the cost on to parents.
Universal Pre-K – quality education starts early, that’s why I support fully funding Universal Pre-K with licensed union educators and trained staff that are paid a living wage.
Expand the full-service community school model to all schools so every family has the support they need for their kids to be ready to learn.
I am committed to fully and equitably funding public education, from preschool to postsecondary.
Ensure all students receive comprehensive sex education that is medically accurate, age-appropriate, and LGBTQIA inclusive.
Amal also supports free tuition for two-year programs and enhanced financial aid for college students to ensure equitable access to higher education for all Minnesotans.
She will work to expand early childhood programs, improve special education funding, and address inequities in K-12 schools.
I support a statewide moratorium on new charter schools.
We must fund wrap-around services and full-service community schools.
I support ensuring that loans held by the state of Minnesota can be forgiven.
Public-service loan forgiveness is an important part of educational reforms.

To fully meet our kids’ needs, we need to lift state levy limits for cities of the first class and fully staffing mental and physical health teams by hiring more licensed school counselors, social workers, psychologists, nurses and other support professionals.
I will do everything in my power to fight for our Minneapolis Public Schools to make sure the state increases per-pupil funding and reimburses districts for the services they are mandated to provide.

I’m committed to increasing funding for the Minnesota State College Grant Program and building on Sen. Dziedzic’s work to make post-secondary education affordable. State-school tuition freezes are also important to make public universities more affordable and help all students afford college - no matter where they attend college.
Improve education to ensure every student has access to academic excellence and a bright future by reducing unfunded mandates and bloated educational administration.
If elected to Congress, I will support programs on the federal level that will allow parents to choose the best school for their child, regardless of their income or zip code.
Increase funding for public schools, with a focus on schools in low-income areas to reduce disparities in educational resources
Provide educators with competitive salaries and professional development resources
Ensure students have ample opportunities to pursue higher education without the burden of a lifetime of debt

Through critical race theory and Marxist indoctrination, teacher unions educate our children to imbecility. Public schools are failing. And while the US ranks last among developed nations, Washington wants to teach our children at even earlier ages. Government-funded K4 has become K3. Soon, the indoctrination will begin at K0. The Marxist’s agenda is to separate children from parental influence as early as possible while teacher unions have long ignored the wishes of parents. Parents know best how to educate their children, not Washington bureaucrats. We must get the Federal Government out of the teaching business and eliminate the Department of Education.
Education Reform: Cut funding for schools promoting radical ideologies and protect students from political indoctrination.
Ensuring federal support for schools prioritizes empowering parents to choose what’s right for their children rather than advancing a one-size-fits-all approach.

Supporting our teachers and public schools by reducing unnecessary bureaucracy, increasing funding for classroom resources, and ensuring educators have the tools they need to focus on what truly matters—helping students reach their full potential.
Increasing transparency around college costs so families can make informed decisions without going into debt.
Expanding access to career and technical education programs to prepare students for high-paying jobs in fields like welding, construction, and healthcare.
He favors the support of alternatives to government education, including charter and private schools.

I will work with every school in FL-6 to ensure that every need is met on a federal level.   This will occur until the Federal Government is removed from the equation with the abolishment of the Department of Education.
I believe that community college should be tuition-free.

I’m committed to increasing funding for the Minnesota State College Grant Program and building on Sen. Dziedzic’s work to make post-secondary education affordable. State-school tuition freezes are also important to make public universities more affordable and help all students afford college - no matter where they attend college.
I will do everything in my power to fight for our Minneapolis Public Schools to make sure the state increases per-pupil funding and reimburses districts for the services they are mandated to provide.

To fully meet our kids’ needs, we need to lift state levy limits for cities of the first class and fully staffing mental and physical health teams by hiring more licensed school counselors, social workers, psychologists, nurses and other support professionals.
Public-service loan forgiveness is an important part of educational reforms.
I support ensuring that loans held by the state of Minnesota can be forgiven.
We must fund wrap-around services and full-service community schools.
I support a statewide moratorium on new charter schools.
Improve education to ensure every student has access to academic excellence and a bright future by reducing unfunded mandates and bloated educational administration.

We need to make sure that school districts are provided with full and flexible budgets, and to allow the school districts to make their own decisions.  We need to return important learning tools to the classroom like phonics!  We need to bring back reading specialists. We need to examine why school district administrative costs have skyrocketed and the effects of increased administration in the schools.

As your legislator, I will champion policies that increase school funding so that our children can continue to access quality education, while simultaneously increasing protections, resources and compensation for teachers and school staff. Teachers and staff are the backbone of our public education system and without proper compensation the field is experiencing alarming brain drain, which has put even more stress upon the environments in which our children learn. We must ensure that teaching remains a desirable profession by ensuring quality compensation and working conditions.
Education is a tool of empowerment. By giving parents the ability to choose where their children learn, we can create lasting opportunities, strengthen families, and build resilient communities.
I support equitable funding for public schools, targeting underserved areas to ensure that zip code does not determine educational quality.
I want to see pilot programs for 9-to-5, year-round school schedules that integrate vocational training, coding, and critical life skills to prepare students for modern economic demands.

In alliance with Gov. Evers $300 million proposal to support kids’ mental health, Jeff will work with counselors, school social workers, teachers and families to increase training and assure there are accessible mental health services for all. This means identifying needs community by community and making connections between service providers so support can be efficient, sustainable and led by experts.

To further support rural districts, Jeff believes legislative adjustments are necessary to address their unique financial challenges. Specifically, the formula for sparsity aid should be modified. Jeff supports expanding this aid to additional districts who serve students in sparsely populated regions of the state - a change that would increase funding to help with costs that exist no matter how many students are served.

Jeff also will use his platform to push back against the negative national narrative surrounding public schools. Jeff will work tirelessly to restore pride in Wisconsin’s public schools, advocating for educators and celebrating the true art of teaching by sharing stories and giving voice to educators across the state. By rising above divisive rhetoric, Jeff will help foster an environment where teachers know they are respected, valued and supported.

One way to alleviate some of the budget pressures faced by rural schools is through collaboration. In Sauk Prairie, for example, students from smaller neighboring districts participate in programs such as CNA courses and business classes – both in person and virtually. Many rural districts share administrative, business services, and special education staff through regional CESA partners. These partnerships help rural districts expand their program offerings without duplicating resources.

He believes in creating additional pathways to attract career changers into the education profession. Whether it’s providing the training needed for educational assistants to earn licensure, creating strong support systems and mentor relationships for new teachers, or welcoming professionals with decades of experience from other fields, Jeff understands that our schools benefit from the diverse, lived experiences of adults from all backgrounds.

Jeff believes tests only make sense when they contribute to the growth of students. This means, using ongoing testing systems that track year-over-year student growth. Tests must provide actionable data that helps schools improve and help students and their families track progress.  Jeff’s approach is more equitable and useful.

An immediate change Jeff will fight for is increased taxpayer transparency regarding voucher programs. Currently, property tax bills do not differentiate between the funds used by public schools and those allocated to the voucher program.

Jeff also recognizes that a key part of retention is empowering teachers to be creative in their classrooms. Many educators have expressed frustration with the growing trend of scripted, rigid curricula that limits their ability to personalize instruction. Jeff believes that educators should be trusted to design classrooms that reflect the unique needs and personalities of their students. This approach fosters a more positive and creative work environment, which in turn helps retain teachers.

Jeff will rebuild DPI’s relationship not only with MPS but with all large districts from day one. He will reestablish regular communication to serve as a better resource for these key district leaders. This regular communication will make him a better advocate in the legislature for MPS, Madison, and other districts. Through these strengthened partnerships, the DPI will work to elevate standards of excellence across all Wisconsin public schools.

DPI must become a transparent, predictable, and innovative agency that truly partners with schools. Under Brittany's leadership, DPI will implement clear processes and best practices, foster innovation, and provide schools with the guidance and support they need to deliver quality instruction. Brittany will create a forward-facing DPI, with an online dashboard for public access to school finances and performance, and clear guidance for schools and school boards.

This is simple: We need to refocus education on teaching reading, writing, and math. These fundamental skills are the foundation of lifelong success, enabling students to pursue meaningful jobs, attend college, or master a trade. Wisconsin kids need an education grounded in the basics that they can build on to achieve their dreams.

Brittany wants to reward quality teachers with the respect and pay they deserve and will work to ensure school funding reaches the classroom. Brittany supports increasing the reimbursement rate for special education services and rural transportation. She is also the only candidate for Superintendent supporting changes to the way choice and charter students are funded to eliminate the impact on and reduce local property taxes.

This is simple: We need to refocus education on teaching reading, writing, and math. These fundamental skills are the foundation of lifelong success, enabling students to pursue meaningful jobs, attend college, or master a trade. Wisconsin kids need an education grounded in the basics that they can build on to achieve their dreams.

Brittany is the only candidate for DPI Superintendent who supports school choice for Wisconsin families. Brittany believes a parent is a child’s first teacher and lifelong advocate, and that active parent engagement makes a school a better, stronger environment for learning. She will transform DPI to be a partner in helping parents champion their children’s education, holding leaders accountable, and supporting excellent schools.

Brittany will restore high academic standards for Wisconsin kids. In her 25+ year career, one thing has become crystal clear to her: Kids rise to meet expectations set for them. And restoring high standards is a critical step to ensuring every Wisconsin child has an opportunity for a bright future.

Jill Underly knows that careers in the skilled trades are good-paying jobs that are badly needed. That’s why Underly raised the standards in career and technical education and invested in creating more opportunities for kids in middle and high school to receive hands-on experience to better prepare for the workforce and today’s economy.

As State Superintendent, Jill Underly worked with Republicans and Democrats to pass a new bipartisan literacy law that will help improve young kids’ reading abilities. The new law hires more reading coaches and shifts students to phonics-based reading instruction for 4-year-old kindergarten through third grade
Secured federal grants to provide millions in funding for mental health services in schools, including peer-to-peer suicide prevention programs and expanded substance abuse prevention initiatives.
Jill has advocated for fair pay, benefits, and working conditions, emphasizing the importance of professional respect and dignity for teachers.

Stan is committed to ensuring every child in the Central Valley has access to a high-quality education that prepares them for success. He supports efforts to expand vocational training and job skills programs so that our students are matched with jobs that meet the demands of today’s economy, ensuring a brighter future for our region.
Support educators with better pay, classroom discipline and less red tape.
A strong education system equips students with the skills needed for future careers, driving our economic growth and community prosperity.
Flat Rate Cyber Charter Tuition Reform

Brittany is the only candidate for DPI Superintendent who supports school choice for Wisconsin families. Brittany believes a parent is a child’s first teacher and lifelong advocate, and that active parent engagement makes a school a better, stronger environment for learning. She will transform DPI to be a partner in helping parents champion their children’s education, holding leaders accountable, and supporting excellent schools.

This is simple: We need to refocus education on teaching reading, writing, and math. These fundamental skills are the foundation of lifelong success, enabling students to pursue meaningful jobs, attend college, or master a trade. Wisconsin kids need an education grounded in the basics that they can build on to achieve their dreams.

Brittany will restore high academic standards for Wisconsin kids. In her 25+ year career, one thing has become crystal clear to her: Kids rise to meet expectations set for them. And restoring high standards is a critical step to ensuring every Wisconsin child has an opportunity for a bright future.

DPI must become a transparent, predictable, and innovative agency that truly partners with schools. Under Brittany's leadership, DPI will implement clear processes and best practices, foster innovation, and provide schools with the guidance and support they need to deliver quality instruction. Brittany will create a forward-facing DPI, with an online dashboard for public access to school finances and performance, and clear guidance for schools and school boards.

Brittany wants to reward quality teachers with the respect and pay they deserve and will work to ensure school funding reaches the classroom. Brittany supports increasing the reimbursement rate for special education services and rural transportation. She is also the only candidate for Superintendent supporting changes to the way choice and charter students are funded to eliminate the impact on and reduce local property taxes.

This is simple: We need to refocus education on teaching reading, writing, and math. These fundamental skills are the foundation of lifelong success, enabling students to pursue meaningful jobs, attend college, or master a trade. Wisconsin kids need an education grounded in the basics that they can build on to achieve their dreams.
A former educator and union member, Jill has advocated for fair pay, benefits, and working conditions, emphasizing the importance of professional respect and dignity for teachers.
Her leadership is focused on supporting teachers, investing in students, and protecting public education at every level.
Ensure students have ample opportunities to pursue higher education without the burden of a lifetime of debt
Provide educators with competitive salaries and professional development resources
Increase funding for public schools, with a focus on schools in low-income areas to reduce disparities in educational resources

Eliminating the U.S Department of Education, which the current administration has vowed to do, is not a wise idea. Money is not everything, but school funding levels reflect the value that we place on the education of our kids. Let’s not sacrifice our children’s potential on the questionable altar of cost-cutting. A federal Department of Education demonstrates how important education is to our nation’s future.
Overtime workers and those who work for tips are some of the hardest workers in our Commonwealth. It’s time we get the government off their backs and let them keep more of their hard-earned money.

I will lead the fight to repeal the car tax and grocery tax. I will never vote to increase your taxes and will fight to lower your taxes and remove costly and burdensome regulations that slow growth and hamstring our businesses. I will support and advance pro-business policies that create and keep jobs in the 32nd District and oppose any new unnecessary regulations.
We should rely more on progressive taxes like income taxes and less on sales taxes.
Amal will push for grants, low-interest loans, and tax incentives to support small business owners, particularly women and people of color.
She also supports raising the minimum wage and expanding childcare access to help working families thrive.
Advocate for responsible budgeting to reduce waste and fraud to keep more money in your pocket.
If elected to Congress, I pledge to support tax cuts wherever possible to ensure families can keep as many of their hard-earned dollars as possible.
If elected to Congress, I will work to enact fiscally responsible budgets that reduce spending while keeping the government open.
Tax Cuts That Matter: Provide sweeping tax relief for workers and eliminate taxes on tips.
No taxes on Social Security, pensions, or tips. He will work with the State of Florida in reducing or eliminating property taxes.  Lower taxes for all Americans.
He will propose a Constitutional Amendment to balance the budget. He fully supports DOGE.

Taxation is theft — especially when the federal government uses your hard-earned money to fund bureaucracies that overreach, mismanage, and harm American prosperity. It’s time to put an end to the IRS and federal income taxes, as we know it today. Let Americans keep more of what they earn and decide how best to invest in their own future. I will champion a system where Americans keep more of their money and Washington’s power is reduced. The time to restore economic freedom is now.
Advocate for responsible budgeting to reduce waste and fraud to keep more money in your pocket.
While we fight for passage in the legislature, we need to partner with local governments to support small businesses in adapting to wage increases through tax credits and incentives.
I believe we need to eliminate regressive loopholes and ensure corporations and high-income individuals contribute fairly.
My mission is to streamline government functions, reduce wasteful spending, and lower taxes for all residents of District 23.

Jimmy believes in providing support for the vulnerable and those in need, but emphasizes a hand up, not a handout. To fund essential services like education, healthcare, and affordable housing, he advocates for large corporations to pay their fair share in taxes, while reducing the burden on middle-class families. By slashing wasteful spending and implementing a more equitable tax system, Jimmy is fighting for a stronger, more inclusive Orange County.

Lets reduce the tax incentives to major corporations, they come in tax free, hire 1000 workers, the workers pay taxes that fund the state, why would it be so bad if the corporations paid their fair share?
Josh believes in being a good steward of the taxpayers’ infrastructure
Promoting Property Tax Relief for Seniors

Brittany wants to fix the current funding formula and shift a greater share of the financial burden back to the state instead of local property taxes. She wants more funding to reach the classroom and reward great teachers, and supports increasing the reimbursement rates for special education and rural transportation. Brittany will work with the legislature and the governor’s office to modernize the school funding formula. Brittany supports “decoupling” funding for choice and charter students from local property taxes as modeled in Milwaukee, a solution that would benefit taxpayers and public schools.
Want to make April 15th just another spring day? The Fair Tax is the best way forward. I am determined to lower taxes and ensure you control more of the money you earn.

Government funding of an NGO makes it a governmental organization. These entities have been exposed as funnels into the pipeline of waste, fraud, and abuse. If you think your causes are a good idea, you pay for them. This will be democracy in action; voting with your dollars. You can hold accountable those who you charge with spending those dollars.
Increase child tax credits by $5,000 per dependent

I will oppose radical, pro-crime policies such as raising the felony larceny threshold or eliminating cash bail. In addition, I will work with local and state law enforcement to ensure we continue to report criminal illegal immigrants to ICE. I am also a strong supporter of the Second Amendment and will fight for every Virginian’s right to defend themselves.
​Advocating for community-centered approaches to reduce crime, improve police accountability, and ensure safer neighborhoods across SD60.
Sanctuary policy, transparency, and accountability build mutual trust between the community and those protecting it.
Decriminalizing non-violent offenses so that people are not punished for behaviors that do not pose a threat to public safety.
Limit use of cash bail for misdemeanor offenses. The balance of your bank account shouldn’t determine whether or not you sit in jail awaiting trial.
Support gun violence prevention that centers the communities most impacted by violence so they can be at the table to lead and receive resources.
Increase funding for comprehensive public safety programs that actually keep people safe, including mental health co-responders, behavioral crisis response, violence interrupters and victim services.
Fund youth employment programs to connect youth to their communities and prevent them from entering the criminal justice system in the first place.
Ban no-knock warrants.
Everyone deserves safe and accessible roadways, walkways, and transit systems, free from harm, discrimination, and violence, ensuring they can reach their destinations with confidence.
I support ending qualified immunity.
I support ending the criminalization of poverty by ending the cash bail system.
I support requiring police officers to carry their own liability insurance.
I support policies and programs meant to prevent and address hate crimes motivated by hate and bias.

Safer mobility means prioritizing infrastructure for walking, biking, and public transit, while reducing unnecessary police interactions. This includes improving public transit, implementing speed-reduction strategies, reducing pretextual stops, and exploring unarmed civilian traffic enforcement.
Support accountability and fairness in the justice system at all levels of government.

I support fully funding our police and giving officers the resources they need to protect our communities. I oppose the efforts by politically motivated, left-wing district attorneys to let offenders off the hook and put criminals back on the streets.
BACK THE BLUE and give first responders the resources they need to keep us safe.

Safer mobility means prioritizing infrastructure for walking, biking, and public transit, while reducing unnecessary police interactions. This includes improving public transit, implementing speed-reduction strategies, reducing pretextual stops, and exploring unarmed civilian traffic enforcement.
I support policies and programs meant to prevent and address hate crimes motivated by hate and bias.
I support requiring police officers to carry their own liability insurance.
I support ending the criminalization of poverty by ending the cash bail system.
I support ending qualified immunity.
Everyone deserves safe and accessible roadways, walkways, and transit systems, free from harm, discrimination, and violence, ensuring they can reach their destinations with confidence.
Support accountability and fairness in the justice system at all levels of government.

As a legislator, I will support policies that address the determinants of crime, provide more resources to unarmed public safety officers, increase access to mental health resources, institutionalize relationships between police forces and community organizations, and invest in youth populations.
By investing in public safety, addressing root causes of crime through education and opportunity, and strengthening community bonds, we can create a future built on trust and resilience.
The most proven way to actually reduce crime is to invest in job programs for marginalized and formerly incarcerated individuals, addressing root causes of crime.
I’ll fight to streamline victim services and advocate for greater restorative programs that prioritize true rehabilitation while still holding offenders accountable.
I’ll push for statewide adoption of the Obama Administration’s 21st Century Policing recommendations, including increased pay and de-escalation training for officers.

I will work tirelessly to ensure they are supported both legislatively and financially. This includes enhancing benefits, improving access to mental health services, and ensuring that law enforcement agencies have the resources they need to safely and effectively perform their duties.
DO NOT defund police
ADD police, fill all open jobs

Recognizing the concerns about rising crime rates, Jimmy stands firmly in support of law enforcement and first responders. He rejects calls to defund the police and instead advocates for better training, hiring practices, and accountability measures. By ensuring that our guardians are the best our nation has to offer, Jimmy aims to create a safer California, where the rule of law is upheld with unwavering dedication.

Climate change is an urgent issue that demands non-partisan action. Jimmy is committed to preserving and enhancing our environment. He also emphasizes the need for practical, sustainable solutions that acknowledge the integral role of natural resources in our society, advocating for a balanced approach to combatting climate change.

The first job of government is to keep its citizens safe. Tony will fight to toughen penalties for criminals and give our police and prosecutors the tools and backing they need to get the bad guys out of our neighborhoods and behind bars. He will oppose crazy woke legislation that prioritize criminals over law-abiding citizens.

A safe community is a strong community, and we can trust Stan Ellis to work tirelessly to protect rule of law and ensure law enforcement has the tools and resources they need to protect our families. He also supports securing our southern border to stop the flow of illegal drugs, human trafficking, and dangerous criminal activity.
Safer Communities – Police, fire, and first responders deserve the funding, training and support needed to help make our communities safer.

Jason is the only experienced candidate who has collaborated with law enforcement in cracking down on 'street takeovers', car theft, and domestic violence crime, and juvenile justice reform. Jason is also the only candidate to openly support our police, establishing the Fallen Officer Fund and calling to repeal recent Police Accountability legislation.
Tough crackdown on criminals.
Ensuring safe communities and readiness for emergencies is vital for protecting lives and property, fostering a secure environment where we can all thrive.
As Juvenile Court Judge, I will ensure that every child is given the opportunity to succeed, through access to the services, guidance, and positive influences they need to thrive.
I am running for Juvenile Court Judge to continue my mission of breaking the cycle of poverty and crime by supporting our youth at the most critical time in their lives.
Secures justice for victims and families
Work to Accelerate Justice. Clear the Backlogs.
by the book constitutionalist
tough-but-fair no-nonsense Judge
As Wisconsin’s Attorney General, known as the state’s “Top Cop,” Brad proudly supported law enforcement and tackled some of the largest criminal justice issues facing the state.

From opening the border to releasing criminals on our streets, rogue judges across the nation are putting their radical agenda above the law. Brad Schimel will take back the Wisconsin Supreme Court and end the madness.

As a former prosecutor and a judge, I know we need Supreme Court justices who understand what it takes to keep communities safe, who are impartial and fair, who will use common sense, and who won’t politicize the constitution to undermine our most basic rights. I also believe people in Wisconsin deserve to feel safe as they go about their lives - in their homes, driving down the road, or walking to the grocery store. My top priority in making decisions is always to make our communities safer.

Unfortunately, domestic abuse, property crimes and crimes related to substance abuse are very real issues Jefferson County faces. As a former prosecutor, I have seen how these crimes affect our community. As Judge, I intend to make sure that those that violate the law are held accountable for their crimes.
I am committed to applying the laws as written to ensure that all individuals are treated equally and fairly under the law.
I believe in the continued use of evidence-based practices to best serve our community and the courts in their decision-making.

The Waukesha Christmas Parade attack presents a stark example of what can happen when a justice system fails to appropriately address violent crime. Zach is committed to locking up criminals who repeatedly violate our laws and sow disorder in our communities.
BACK THE BLUE and give first responders the resources they need to keep us safe.

As your State Senator, I will advance policies that help ease the burden on expectant mothers and fathers in order to reduce the number of abortions and save lives. Under current Virginia law, late-term abortion is illegal and must remain so. I will always fight for those who cannot fight for themselves.
As Senator, he will continue to fight any effort by Republicans to restrict women’s bodily autonomy.

As the father of two young daughters, JJ will fight to protect access to reproductive freedom so that they don’t grow up with less rights than their mother. In Richmond JJ will proudly vote to codify abortion access into Virginia’s Constitution.
Cease public funding for organizations like Crisis Pregnancy Centers that mislead the public, deny access to sex-eduation and medical care, and delay access to reproductive care services.
Maintain access to sexual and reproductive healthcare for all people and defend the right to choose.
Provide financing to reproductive care clinics that are at risk of closing or limiting services due to lack of funding.
Amal supports the Minnesota Equal Rights Amendment to ensure gender equality and protect reproductive freedom.
Amal is committed to safeguarding reproductive rights in Minnesota.
She will fight for expanded funding for reproductive healthcare providers, equitable maternal care, and comprehensive sex education.
Abortion is healthcare.
Minnesota can and should ensure abortion access in its constitution. No matter what happens as a federal level, Minnesota must remain a safe haven for anyone seeking an abortion.

I am pro-life and believe in the sanctity of life and protecting the lives of the unborn. The left has become increasingly radical on this issue, supporting abortions for any reason up until the point of birth. In Congress, I will oppose any and all efforts to spend taxpayer dollars on abortion.
Access to comprehensive reproductive healthcare and the right to choose
He is ardently pro-life and supports the biblical view that life begins at conception.  He believes that no federal tax monies should support Planned Parenthood.
DEFEND life.
Minnesota can and should ensure abortion access in its constitution. No matter what happens as a federal level, Minnesota must remain a safe haven for anyone seeking an abortion.
Abortion is healthcare.

The fall of Roe V Wade has created an exceptionally unsafe environment for those seeking reproductive healthcare in this country. Your body, your choice. Full stop. I will support policies that affirm a person’s right to choose what to do with their reproductive health. I will defend this right to choose from any attempt to undermine it. I am proud of the work we have done in the State of Minnesota to affirm this right after the fall of Roe v. Wade and I will passionately carry on this work as your legislator.
Protect the sanctity of life.
From the unborn to the elderly, I will advocate for policies that protect life and ensure that our societal actions reflect our moral convictions.

I am deeply committed to protecting life at every stage. This commitment is reflected in my unwavering support for pro-life initiatives and legislation that honors and respects the inherent dignity of every human being.
Protect the Sanctity of Life.
Sean didn’t need to “evolve” on women’s rights. Sean was a 100% ally from day one, but it goes beyond that. Sean initiated important women’s rights legislation — and got it passed.
Pro-life
Support Biblical principles like protecting the right to life.
Pro-life
Access to comprehensive reproductive healthcare and the right to choose

I feel it is important to discuss abortion within the context of healthcare. An abortion is a medical procedure. Women need to be able to discuss options safely and privately only with their families and doctors. Having a child, or deciding to abort it, is a very personal decision.
DEFEND the right to life
Kannan supports common sense gun reform policies that reduce violence and improve safety across the Commonwealth, including an assault weapons ban.

Gun violence is now the leading cause of death for our children. JJ knows that this is unacceptable. JJ will fight every day to pass common sense gun safety legislation, close dangerous loopholes, and require the safe storage of guns to keep our kids and community safe.
She also supports safe storage requirements and community-based violence prevention programs to keep Minnesotans safe.
Gun violence is a public health crisis.
Amal will advocate for universal background checks, banning assault weapons, and implementing red flag laws.

I fully support the Second Amendment and the right of law-abiding citizens to bear arms and believe that right must not be infringed upon. I oppose the multitude of new regulations Democrats put forward each year to make it more difficult for lawful gun owners to exercise their right to obtain firearms and own and use them legally.
Universal Background Checks on ALL gun sales to close existing loopholes and ensure every sale includes a thorough background check
Strengthening and expanding Extreme Risk Protection Orders (ERPOs), commonly known as Red Flag Laws, to empower concerned family members and law enforcement
Protect the Constitution: Defend free speech, religious liberty, and the Second Amendment.
He fully supports the 2nd Amendment.
PROTECT the Second Amendment at all costs.

As your legislator, I promise to continually seek policy solutions that will curb gun violence in our state as the courts’ jurisprudence around firearms evolves over time. Immediately, I will support policies that keep dangerous weapons out of the hands of those most likely to cause harm, such as violent offenders, individuals with restraining orders on them, individuals with a history of violence, and repeat criminal offenders. In my first term, I will propose safe storage laws that penalize gun-owners, especially gun-owners with children, who fail to comply with common-sense storage standards.
Thoughtful policies that respect lawful gun ownership and prioritize community safety can create an environment where everyone feels secure and protected.

Jimmy acknowledges the urgent need to address gun violence in our nation. He supports measures such as stricter background checks, periodic training requirements, and increased regulations on firearms ownership. By advocating for the removal of weapons of war from our streets and implementing sensible red flag legislation, Jimmy aims to protect our communities and ensure that our children can attend school without fear.
pro-gun
NRA member, staunch Second Amendment supporter.
Strengthening and expanding Extreme Risk Protection Orders (ERPOs), commonly known as Red Flag Laws, to empower concerned family members and law enforcement
Universal Background Checks on ALL gun sales to close existing loopholes and ensure every sale includes a thorough background check
Protect the second amendment

As Senator, Kannan will continue to expand affordable housing options through housing assistance programs, stronger tenant protections, inclusionary zoning, and development incentives. So that every Virginian has an opportunity to own a home, he is committed to reducing barriers to homeownership by limiting corporate purchases of rental properties and single-family homes.
Creating pathways to stable, affordable housing for families, students, and seniors in the district.
Investing in affordable housing and support services to provide long-term solutions for those experiencing homelessness.
Houselessness is a public health crisis, representing a failure in governance that hurts Black, Indigenous, and Trans folks. We must ensure housing for all.
I believe that housing is a human right, and everyone deserves a safe, dignified place to live.
Advocate for land-use policies that support missing middle housing, striking a balance between affordability and density to ensure that housing is available to all, regardless of income.
Work to expand naturally occurring affordable housing and build more housing along transit corridors to create vibrant, accessible communities where people can live, work, and thrive.
Address the energy burden that many families face by supporting programs that reduce utility costs, lower pollution, and make homes more energy efficient.

Mandate a “Housing first” approach to homelessness with increased coordination between counties, state agencies, and service providers to find unhoused residents permanent housing and provide the wrap-around services needed for success.
Expand funding to public housing to ensure all our public housing residents have safe and clean homes.
Hold predatory landlords accountable for their mistreatment of our neighbors and strengthen renter protections so everyone can have dignified housing.
Affordable housing is a human right.
She is committed to addressing racial disparities in housing and investing in targeted, culturally informed solutions to ensure every Minnesotan has access to a safe and stable home.
Amal will champion policies that expand supportive housing programs like Avivo Village, prevent evictions with just-cause protections, and increase funding for rent subsidies.
Housing is a human right!

We need sustainable and ongoing funding for shelters. There is an estimated 13 million fiscal cliff facing Hennepin County Shelters, specifically low-barrier and emergency shelter space. As your Senator, I will work tirelessly next session to address this need.
There’s an over 200 million capital backlog for public housing in our city. I support increasing funding for public housing in Minneapolis.

I will work with City, County, State, and Federal officials to address unsheltered homelessness. Together, we can support funding housing first initiatives, culturally specific housing services, low-barrier housing, and deeply affordable housing.
I support investing in the Stable Homes Stable Schools program as a commitment to our neighbors.
I will support projects like Avivo Village, housing-first solutions, housing-focused case management, and 24/7 shelter services.
Minnesota can make bold, sustained investments in income-based public housing, deeply affordable housing, and workforce housing all across the state.

I support the “missing middle” legislation for single-family and high-density housing. By requiring cities to allow duplexes, triplexes, and other “missing middle” housing types, we can both increase supply and create density that makes transit, cycling, and walking more possible.
Support legislation like the Place to Prosper Act – which would reduce rent increases, make evictions more difficult, and ban source of income discrimination
Incentivize the construction of affordable housing
Expand rental assistance for low-income families

I support the “missing middle” legislation for single-family and high-density housing. By requiring cities to allow duplexes, triplexes, and other “missing middle” housing types, we can both increase supply and create density that makes transit, cycling, and walking more possible.
Minnesota can make bold, sustained investments in income-based public housing, deeply affordable housing, and workforce housing all across the state.
I will support projects like Avivo Village, housing-first solutions, housing-focused case management, and 24/7 shelter services.
I support investing in the Stable Homes Stable Schools program as a commitment to our neighbors.

I will work with City, County, State, and Federal officials to address unsheltered homelessness. Together, we can support funding housing first initiatives, culturally specific housing services, low-barrier housing, and deeply affordable housing.
There’s an over 200 million capital backlog for public housing in our city. I support increasing funding for public housing in Minneapolis.

We need sustainable and ongoing funding for shelters. There is an estimated 13 million fiscal cliff facing Hennepin County Shelters, specifically low-barrier and emergency shelter space. As your Senator, I will work tirelessly next session to address this need.
Housing is a human right!

As a legislator, I will support legislation that provides incentives for residential property developers to provide affordable housing options. I will work with municipal governments to craft legislation that ensures that state law allows and, in fact, incentivizes reformation of zoning codes to foster affordable housing development. I will use my position as a legislator to build a coalition between local government, developers, and local stakeholder groups to make sure that our state’s housing policy is responsive to a dynamic housing market.

Connecticut housing prices are among the most expensive in the country, and it's largely driven by missing housing stock. For young people like myself to afford to live here, we need more available rental and starter home opportunities - and we can increase the amount of affordable housing responsibly and creatively, through brownfield remediation and transit-oriented development.
Helping First-Time Homebuyers
Expand rental assistance for low-income families
Incentivize the construction of affordable housing
Support legislation like the Place to Prosper Act – which would reduce rent increases, make evictions more difficult, and ban source of income discrimination
New Homeowner Credits - Extend $50,000 down payment assistance for first time home buyers
A strong supporter of unions and opponent of corporate greed, Kannan supports repealing right-to-work and empowering workers’ bargaining power.
Every worker deserves a living wage.

Expand unemployment insurance to workers forced to go on strike by their employers. Workers on strike should have the same right to unemployment insurance as everyone else in Minnesota who is out of a job.
Expand collective bargaining rights to more Minnesotan workers and oppose any attempts to implement right-to-work laws.
Raise the minimum wage to 20 per hour so everyone can afford to thrive, not just survive.
Secure and expand the right to organize and collectively bargain.
Treat wage theft as the crime that it is and expand co-enforcement by labor organizations who best know the needs of workers in their industries.
No Minnesota teacher should make less than 60,000 per year, and every school employee deserves at least 25/hour.

I will fight against privatization of public services like education, and for collective bargaining because our neighbors don’t just need jobs— they need good jobs that let them pay their bills and watch their kids grow up.
Phase out the discriminatory practice of paying people with disabilities a subminimum wage.

Our energy transition must be built with prevailing wages and union tradespeople. Paying people what they’re worth is good for workers and for business. Workers with disposable income fuel economies and workers who are secure are most productive.
Equal pay for equal work and closing the gender pay gap

Our energy transition must be built with prevailing wages and union tradespeople. Paying people what they’re worth is good for workers and for business. Workers with disposable income fuel economies and workers who are secure are most productive.
Phase out the discriminatory practice of paying people with disabilities a subminimum wage.

I will fight against privatization of public services like education, and for collective bargaining because our neighbors don’t just need jobs— they need good jobs that let them pay their bills and watch their kids grow up.
No Minnesota teacher should make less than 60,000 per year, and every school employee deserves at least 25/hour.
As a legislator, I will take every opportunity to strengthen the collective power of workers through labor unions.
I will push for state legislation inspired by the PRO Act to strengthen union protections, criminalize union-busting, and enable gig workers to access benefits.
I will advocate for a state minimum wage above the federal level, indexed to inflation, ensuring that it reflects the true cost of living.
I’ll advocate for higher wages and better professional development for educators to attract and retain top talent.
Equal pay for equal work and closing the gender pay gap

JJ knows that prices are too high, from education, to groceries, to tolls. In the House of Delegates JJ will work across the aisle to lower costs to make sure that every family can afford to not just get by, but get ahead.
Supporting small businesses, creating job opportunities, and fostering economic growth in Northeast Minneapolis and Riverside.
Finally, we need to make our economy more resilient so it is able to withstand the economic attacks from our competitors, like China, and so we aren’t dependent on them for critical supply chains.

In short, inflation is a factor of increased money supply. The solution is simple: massive spending cuts, end QE, and let the markets set rates. While painful, this is the only solution, or we will see another spike in inflation that will dwarf prior readings. If you’re going to smoke a carton a day, don’t expect the cancer treatments to be fun. We got here after years of fiscal insanity. Getting out won’t happen overnight.

My economic plan returns the budget to pre-COVID levels, reduces corporate taxes, makes the Trump tax cuts permanent, and guts the growth-killing regulatory environment. And we cannot bend to the climate zealots. Their agenda is built on lies masquerading as science, not about saving the planet but control and global wealth redistribution.
End Inflation: Implement pro-growth policies to lower costs and stabilize prices.
Addressing inflation through responsible spending cuts that reduce the national debt without undermining vital programs like Social Security, Medicare, or veterans' benefits.
Supporting small businesses by reducing burdensome regulations and implementing tax policies that allow them to grow, create jobs, and boost the local economy.
he believes keeping Florida open safely for businesses is vital to keeping our economy healthy while keeping Floridians healthy.

Red tape hurts local businesses makes it impossible for entrepreneurs to compete. I will work to cut regulation and reduce self-employment taxes to let Florida’s robust small business economy flourish.

Under the current administration, our economy is faltering—inflation is skyrocketing, job opportunities are shrinking, and the American worker is feeling the squeeze. A government debt reduction plan is essential. Our solution: I will work to return America to the pro-growth policies that made us the envy of the world under President Trump. By cutting taxes, reducing regulation, and promoting domestic manufacturing, we can unleash the potential of the American people. This is about creating real, enduring prosperity for hardworking families, and putting America first in every business deal; domestic and abroad.
COUNTER the effects of inflation and lower prices.
LOWER insurance rates and hold insurance companies accountable.
Federal regulatory reform is key to stabilize current economic conditions
By fostering innovation, expanding opportunities, and attracting investment, we’ll create jobs, strengthen families, and build a brighter future for our community.
Our district thrives when small businesses, entrepreneurs, and key industries have the tools to succeed.
I will promote policies that reduce red tape for small businesses while safeguarding against corporate predation.

Jimmy understands that the American economy is on the path to recovery, and he aims to unleash its full potential. With a focus on reducing regulations and taxes for small businesses, he envisions an economy where everyone has the opportunity to pursue the American Dream. By nurturing growth, we can curb inflation, reduce living costs, and create a robust tax base, propelling Orange County into a prosperous future.

High taxes and burdensome regulations in California stifling economic growth and increasing the cost of living – are driving businesses and families out of state.  Californians have fewer opportunities and struggle with the rising cost of living. It’s time to cut taxes, slash red tape, and bring back growth and prosperity so hard-working Californians can succeed.

The Central Valley feeds our great nation, and it’s Stan Ellis’ priority to ensure that our farmers and ranchers have the resources they need to be successful. By advocating for common sense water policies, investing in critical water storage projects, and protecting the Valley’s access to reliable water supplies, he will not only protect the Central Valley but help it thrive. Agriculture is the backbone of our economy, and Stan will work tirelessly to preserve it for future generations.

Small businesses are the heart of the Central Valley’s economy. Stan Ellis will fight against burdensome regulations and policies that stifle growth. He understands the challenges business owners face and is committed to creating an environment that promotes their success and allows for their continued growth.

Stan Ellis knows that families and businesses thrive when government gets out of the way. He is committed to reducing taxes, eliminating unnecessary regulations, and fostering an environment that will help our local businesses grow and create jobs. Stan will fight against tax increases, protect critically important Proposition 13, and ensure that you keep more of your hard-earned money.

Make Maine Affordable – Long-time Mainers are being priced out of their communities and young families are leaving. We must fight to lower the cost of energy, housing, taxes, and living here in Maine.
Support Small Business – Family businesses are disappearing here in Maine yet politicians in Augusta pile on with burdensome taxes and regulations. This has to change.

Bob believes that residents and families deserve a more affordable state. which is why Bob plans to address energy costs, invest in our schools, and protect spending guardrails to maintain a sustainable budget.

Residents and families deserve a more affordable state, which is why Jason has been credited with passing the largest income tax cut in Connecticut history, a historic investment in education, and abiding by spending guardrails to help reduce debt and spend taxpayer dollars wisely.
Smaller Government, Less Regulation: Let us live and work without unnecessary interference.
Hoss proudly supports President Trump’s America First agenda to secure our borders, protect freedoms, and grow the economy.
Support for Small Businesses: As a business owner, I know what it takes to create jobs and grow our economy.
Promote pro-growth, pro-business policies that build a strong economy with good jobs by holding the line against new taxes and regulation.
He believes keeping Florida open safely for businesses is vital to keeping our economy healthy while keeping Floridians healthy.
The American economy needs a strong manufacturing sector. Congress would work to re-shore American manufacturing, bringing good, stable jobs to Florida and the rest of the nation.

The solution to inflation is simple. Reducing government spending is the beginning of it all. When Congress passes omnibus spending bills the amount of waste and what used to be called pork is immense. Sunlight is the best disinfectant. I will promote single subject spending bills that will be easy to understand. This will make it more clear where tax dollars are being spent. The bills can live or die on their own merit.
It's time to cut government spending, trim back regulations, and create an environment where both individuals and businesses can thrive.
Senior Credits - Make cost of living adjustments more frequent—quarterly COLA’s

Provide an additional insurance payment to families and businesses in geographic locations where a natural disaster, such as a hurricane, has occurred, and/or the State Governor or the President has declared an emergency. The amount to be determined by loss, etc.
Small Business or “gig” Credits - Offer $20,000 business loan assistance for development
COUNTER the effects of inflation and lower prices.

We have seen a frightening rise in dangerous illegal immigrant crime due to sanctuary policies in neighboring counties that prioritize illegal immigrants over the safety of our communities. Democrats in the House of Delegates could fix this in one vote, but have refused to act. As your Delegate, I will introduce legislation to forbid any locality from restricting the enforcement of federal immigration laws and remove any barriers that prevent law enforcement from keeping us safe.
Supporting immigrant and refugee communities in Riverside and advocating for equity and inclusion across all sectors.

We must rectify our city’s shortcomings, preparing us to receive newcomers with open arms and just living conditions. We will restore human dignity to those whose dignity has been robbed by immigration law.
I support the North Star Act that will protect our immigrant neighbors and keep our communities together.

If elected to Congress, I look forward to working with President Trump to complete the border wall and to put an end to the flow of illegal migrants across our southern border, as well as the influx of drugs like fentanyl that are killing Americans. I saw these dangers firsthand when I led anti-cartel and anti-drug trafficking aerial missions throughout the Gulf of Mexico, and the illegal immigration problem has only gotten exponentially worse since then. We have to also work to deport the millions of illegal immigrants that are currently here, particularly prioritizing those who have committed additional crimes while in our country. In order to allow highly skilled, patriotic legal immigrants to come to our country who respect our laws and can help build our economy, we have to solve this problem immediately.
Seal the Border: Shut down illegal border crossings and stop the migrant surge.
Largest Deportation Operation in History: Remove individuals residing in the U.S. unlawfully to restore order and fairness to immigration.
Crush Migrant Crime: Target foreign drug cartels, end gang violence, and lock up repeat offenders.

Cracking down on drug cartels and human traffickers, targeting those who exploit weaknesses in our system to bring harm to vulnerable people and flood our communities with dangerous drugs like fentanyl.
Passing legislation to prioritize the completion of the border wall and ensure funding is directed toward its construction as a critical tool for border security.
Advocating for and codifying policies like the Migrant Protection Protocols (MPP) to ensure a lawful and orderly process for asylum seekers while protecting the integrity of our immigration system.

Securing sufficient funding and resources for Border Patrol and law enforcement agents, equipping them with advanced technology, additional personnel, and the tools they need to protect our borders effectively.

He strongly opposes illegal immigration. He supports a secure northern and southern border. He would support immigration reform based on merit, the shortening of the process for entry, and shortening of the administrative review process.

The borders are wide open and America is being flooded with illegal immigrants who steal jobs, drain resources from American citizens, and disadvantage Americans to a second class position. Illegal aliens are criminals and mass deportations are my national priority! Law and order in this nation starts at the border. We must immediately start enforcing our immigration laws, send criminals back to their home countries, and ensure that only those who come legally are allowed to enter. Americans must come first, and this means we bring to an end the era of open borders and illegal immigration.
SECURE our borders.
I support the North Star Act that will protect our immigrant neighbors and keep our communities together.
Secure the southern border—no amnesty or “sanctuary cities” for illegal aliens.

Immigration must be legal but reasonable. Because of the enormous amount of people around the globe that wish for the abundance that is offered in the United States, the numbers of people that we allow into our neighborhood must be metered. As long as welfare and housing payments are provided by tax dollars those payments should be reserved for citizens. Assistance can be provided by private non government organizations to anyone who is in need.

Lastly, there has been discussion, lately, that when a person is born here, he or she might not be a citizen if their parents emigrated illegally from a foreign country. But the 14th Amendment to the United States Constitution is very clear: if you are born in the United States, then you are an American citizen.

The United States immigration system needs to be comprehensively reformed. People should be able to enter our country legally if they follow the process of obtaining worker permits (green cards) or pursue citizenship. We also need to better fund the U.S. Customs and Border Patrol so that it can do its job of protecting us from real criminals such as drug runners (who, by the way, are usually not immigrants).
SECURE our borders.
Expanding affordable health care options for residents, including mental health services for students and underserved populations.
I will fight political underrepresentation and discrimination towards neurodivergence and those with disabilities.
We must recognize the mental health crisis as a public health crisis and address it by providing decent working and living conditions with basic access to care.
I’ll stand up for gender-affirming care and make sure everyone in Minnesota can access the healthcare they need to live authentically.
Cease public funding for organizations like Crisis Pregnancy Centers that mislead the public, deny access to sex-eduation and medical care, and delay access to reproductive care services.
Expand data privacy in healthcare for reproductive health and trans health.
Healthcare is a human right.
She will fight for comprehensive coverage, including mental health, dental, and addiction treatment services, while addressing rural healthcare disparities and improving maternal health outcomes.
Amal supports moving toward a single-payer universal healthcare system and expanding MinnesotaCare to include more residents.
We must ensure that everyone has access to affordable gender affirming care.
I support the work of the Prescription Drug Affordability Board established in 2023 by the DFL trifecta.
Every Minnesotan needs and deserves quality healthcare. It’s what allows us all to grow and thrive and then to age in our own homes with dignity and care.

I will support John Marty’s plan for universal healthcare. It covers prescription drugs, vision care, dental care, hearing care, mental-health services, home care and nursing care services, chemical dependency treatment, and medical equipment and supplies. The Minnesota Health Plan will cover the medical needs of all our neighbors and families.
Health decisions are best left to patients and their doctors.
I support investing in preventative and restorative mental health and substance abuse services.
Defend the Affordable Care Act
Ensure that all Americans have access to quality doctors, preventative health care, and treatment for their physical and mental health
Expand Medicaid
Protect Medicare
Reduce prescription costs
Improving FEMA’s disaster response to ensure that communities receive the aid they need promptly, without unnecessary delays or red tape.
Reforming the National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP) to ensure premiums are affordable while maintaining comprehensive coverage for homeowners and businesses.
Advocating for disaster mitigation programs that help families strengthen their properties, reducing damage and future insurance costs.
I support investing in preventative and restorative mental health and substance abuse services.
Health decisions are best left to patients and their doctors.

I will support John Marty’s plan for universal healthcare. It covers prescription drugs, vision care, dental care, hearing care, mental-health services, home care and nursing care services, chemical dependency treatment, and medical equipment and supplies. The Minnesota Health Plan will cover the medical needs of all our neighbors and families.
Every Minnesotan needs and deserves quality healthcare. It’s what allows us all to grow and thrive and then to age in our own homes with dignity and care.
I support the work of the Prescription Drug Affordability Board established in 2023 by the DFL trifecta.
We must ensure that everyone has access to affordable gender affirming care.

As a legislator, I would support moving Minnesota to a universal healthcare system, while staunchly defending our Medicare and Medicaid programs. No Minnesotan should have to be concerned about their insurance coverage.   I would follow the example of the Alec Smith Insulin Affordability Act, by supporting legislation that would institute a monthly cap to the cost of other life saving drugs, including prescription drugs that treat asthma, diabetes, and other chronic diseases for eligible individuals.   I would support legislation to require health care professionals to undergo regular cultural competency training in order to stay in touch with the needs of the changing demographics of our state.

Mental health impacts every aspect of life, especially for children and families. Expanding access to affordable, high-quality services and breaking the stigma around seeking help are essential steps toward empowering individuals and building a stronger, healthier community.
